title: When was paper money invented? - Quora

response.answer_text: Paper bills were first used by the Chinese, who started carrying folding money during the Tang Dynasty (A.D. 618-907) — mostly in the form of privately issued bills of credit or exchange notes — and used it for more than 500 years before the practice began to catch on in Europe in the 17th century. The word cash was originally used to describe the type of round bronze coins with square holes commonly used in the Tang Dynasty, called kai-yuans.

Around 700 AD- 900 AD, evolving from Chinese merchants’ and bankers’ letters of credit. Paper money seems to have been invented in China, where paper seems to have been invented. (No, papyrus doesn’t count.) Top 10 Things You Didn't Know About Money - TIME Museum of the National Bank of Belgium
